alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 11:32PM EDT until May 16 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN NASH...WEST CENTRAL EDGECOMBE...WILSON AND NORTHEASTERN JOHNSTON COUNTIES... At 1131 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Nashville to 8 miles southwest of Bailey to near Clayton, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount, Smithfield, Nashville, Wilson, Clayton, Elm City, Bailey, Micro, Selma and Sharpsburg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
